ssGUI::​Hierarchy
ssGUI::​Hierarchy
ssGUI::​GUIObject

This manages all the information related to the hierarchy status of a GUI Object

Variables & Constructor
public:
    struct ChildInfo                                                                                    //Holds infomation about a child, used internally
    {
        public:
            friend class Hierarchy;

            bool operator==(ChildInfo const& other)
            {
                //return ChildIndex == other.ChildIndex && CompositeChild == other.CompositeChild;
                return ChildIndex == other.ChildIndex;
            };

        private:
            ssGUIObjectIndex ChildIndex = -1;
            bool CompositeChild = false;
    };

    using ChildToken = std::list<ChildInfo>::iterator;                                                  //See <GetCurrentChildToken>

protected:
    ssGUIObjectIndex Parent;                                                                            //See <GetParent>
    std::list<ChildInfo> Children;                                                                      //See <GetListOfChildren>
    ChildToken CurrentChild;                                                                            //See <GetCurrentChild> and <GetCurrentChildToken>
    bool CurrentChildIteratorFrontEnd;                                                                  //See <IsChildrenIteratorEnd>
    bool CurrentChildIteratorBackEnd;                                                                   //See <IsChildrenIteratorEnd>
    bool UserCreated;                                                                                   //See <IsUserCreated>
    bool ObjectDelete;                                                                                  //See <Delete>
    bool HeapAllocated;                                                                                 //See <IsHeapAllocated>
    ObjectsReferences CurrentObjectsReferences;                                                         //See <Internal_GetObjectsReferences>
    bool DestroyEventCalled;                                                                            //(Internal variable) Flag for calling <OnObjectDestroyEventCallback>
    std::vector<std::tuple<bool, bool, ChildToken>> StashedChildIterators;                              //See <StashChildrenIterator>
    bool Focused;                                                                                       //See <IsFocused>

    ssGUI::Renderer* CurrentRenderer;                                                                   //(Internal variable) Used to send redraw signal
    ssGUI::EventCallbackManager* CurrentEventCallbackManager;                                           //(Internal variable) Used to call any event callbacks listeners
    ssGUI::Transform* CurrentTransform;                                                                 //(Internal variable) Used to set the global position when the parent is being set
    ssGUI::GUIObject* CurrentObject;                                                                    //(Internal variable) Used to <Internal_AddChild> for the new parent when it is being set
Hierarchy::Hierarchy() :    Parent(-1),
                            Children(),
                            CurrentChild(Children.end()),
                            CurrentChildIteratorFrontEnd(true),
                            CurrentChildIteratorBackEnd(true),
                            UserCreated(true),
                            ObjectDelete(false),
                            HeapAllocated(false),
                            CurrentObjectsReferences(),
                            DestroyEventCalled(false),
                            StashedChildIterators(),
                            Focused(false),
                            CurrentRenderer(nullptr),
                            CurrentEventCallbackManager(nullptr),
                            CurrentTransform(nullptr),
                            CurrentObject(nullptr)
{}
Functions
GetParent
virtual ssGUI::GUIObject* GetParent() const

Gets the parent of the GUI Object. Nullptr will be returned if there's no parent set.

SetParent
virtual void SetParent(
ssGUI::GUIObject* newParent,
bool compositeChild = false
)

Sets the parent of the GUI Object. Setting nullptr will unset the parent.  Consider using ssGUI::ssGUIManager::AddGUIObjectAsChild or AddChild instead if possible

AddChild
template<typename T> T* AddChild(
bool compositeChild = false
)

Adds a GUI Object as a child of this GUI Object.  The lifetime of the child GUI object is managed by ssGUIManager if this GUI object is (recursively) added to ssGUIManager.  Otherwise, the user needs to manage the lifetime of the child GUI object.

AddChild
template<typename T> T* AddChild(
ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentHorizontal horizontalAlignment,
ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentVertical verticalAlignment,
bool compositeChild = false
)

Same as above but with AdvancedPosition extension added

AddChildWithWrapper
template<typename T> T* AddChildWithWrapper(
bool compositeChild = false
)

Same as AddChild but with empty GUI object as a wrapper

AddChildWithWrapper
template<typename T> T* AddChildWithWrapper(
ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentHorizontal horizontalAlignment,
ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentVertical verticalAlignment,
bool compositeChild = false
)

Same as above but with AdvancedPosition extension added

AddChildBefore
template<typename T> T* AddChildBefore(
ssGUI::GUIObject* target,
bool compositeChild = false
)

Same as AddChild but inserted before the target

template<typename T> T* AddChildBefore(
ssGUI::GUIObject* target,
ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentHorizontal horizontalAlignment,
ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentVertical verticalAlignment,
bool compositeChild = false
)

Same as above but with AdvancedPosition extension added

ssGUI::GUIObject* target,
bool compositeChild = false
)

Same as AddChildBefore but with empty GUI object as a wrapper

ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentHorizontal horizontalAlignment,
ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentVertical verticalAlignment,
bool compositeChild = false
)

Same as above but with AdvancedPosition extension added

ssGUI::GUIObject* target,
bool compositeChild = false
)

Same as AddChild but inserted after the target

AddChildAfter
template<typename T> T* AddChildAfter(
ssGUI::GUIObject* target,
ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentHorizontal horizontalAlignment,
ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentVertical verticalAlignment,
bool compositeChild = false

ssGUI::Enums::AlignmentVertical verticalAlignment,
bool compositeChild = false

Same as above but with AdvancedPosition extension added

IsCurrentChildComposite
virtual bool IsCurrentChildComposite() const

Returns true if the current child the children iterator is on (see MoveChildrenIteratorToChild) is part of a composite GUI Object

GetChildrenCount
virtual int GetChildrenCount() const

Returns the number of children parented to this GUI Object. (Non recursive)

MoveChildrenIteratorToFirst
virtual void MoveChildrenIteratorToFirst()

Moves the children iterator to the first child.  To preserve the current children iterator, use StashChildrenIterator.

Please note that if the current children iterator points to a child that is removed then it will be invalid and IsChildrenIteratorEnd will return true.

MoveChildrenIteratorToLast
virtual void MoveChildrenIteratorToLast()

Moves the children iterator to the last child.  To preserve the current children iterator, use StashChildrenIterator.

Please note that if the current children iterator points to a child that is removed then it will be invalid and IsChildrenIteratorEnd will return true.

MoveChildrenIteratorNext
virtual void MoveChildrenIteratorNext()

Moves the children iterator to the next child.  To preserve the current children iterator, use StashChildrenIterator.

Please note that if the current children iterator points to a child that is removed then it will be invalid and IsChildrenIteratorEnd will return true.

MoveChildrenIteratorPrevious
virtual void MoveChildrenIteratorPrevious()

Moves the children iterator to the previous child.  To preserve the current children iterator, use StashChildrenIterator.

Please note that if the current children iterator points to a child that is removed then it will be invalid and IsChildrenIteratorEnd will return true.

MoveChildrenIteratorToChild
virtual bool MoveChildrenIteratorToChild(
ssGUI::GUIObject* child
)

Moves the children iterator to the target child if it is directly parented to this GUI Object.  Returns true if exists, false otherwise and children iterator is untouched.  To preserve the current children iterator, use StashChildrenIterator.

IsChildrenIteratorLast
virtual bool IsChildrenIteratorLast()

Returns true if the iterator is on the last child

IsChildrenIteratorFirst
virtual bool IsChildrenIteratorFirst()

Returns true if the iterator is on the first child

IsChildrenIteratorEnd
virtual bool IsChildrenIteratorEnd()

Returns true if the iterator is beyond the first or last child

StashChildrenIterator
virtual void StashChildrenIterator()

Stores the current children iterator on the stack. Any modification will not affect the children iterator.  However, if the stashed children iterator points to a child that is removed then the stashed children iterator will be invalid and IsChildrenIteratorEnd will be true when the stashed iterator is restored (popped).

PopChildrenIterator
virtual void PopChildrenIterator()

Pops the most recent stashed children iterator back to the current children iterator.

Please note that if the stashed children iterator points to a child that is removed then the stashed children iterator will be invalid, meaning IsChildrenIteratorEnd will be true.

FindChild
virtual bool FindChild(
ssGUI::GUIObject* child
)

Returns if a child exists and is directly parented to this GUI Object.  This doesn't modify the children iterator.

GetChild
virtual ssGUI::GUIObject* GetChild(
std::string childName,
bool recursive = false
) const

Gets the first child with specified name. Nullptr if not found.

GetChild
template<typename T> T* GetChild(
std::string childName,
bool recursive = false
) const

See above

GetChildrenWithTag
virtual void GetChildrenWithTag(
std::string tag,
std::vector<ssGUI::GUIObject*>& foundChildren,
bool recursive = false
) const

Gets all the children that have the specified tag

GetCurrentChild
virtual ssGUI::GUIObject* GetCurrentChild()

Returns the object the children iterator is currently pointing to. This will remove nullptr if it is not pointing at any child.  To check if the current children iterator is valid, use IsChildrenIteratorEnd.

GetCurrentChildToken
virtual ssGUI::Hierarchy::ChildToken GetCurrentChildToken()

Returns the underlying childrenIterator used for this GUI Object

MoveChildBeforeTargetChild
virtual bool MoveChildBeforeTargetChild(
ssGUI::GUIObject* child,
ssGUI::GUIObject* target
)

Moves the child before the target.  Returns true if both the child and target are directly parented and the move operation is successful, false otherwise.

MoveChildAfterTargetChild
virtual bool MoveChildAfterTargetChild(
ssGUI::GUIObject* child,
ssGUI::GUIObject* target
)

Moves the child after the target.  Returns true if both the child and target are directly parented and the move operation is successful, false otherwise.

MoveLastChildBeforeTargetChild
virtual bool MoveLastChildBeforeTargetChild(
ssGUI::GUIObject* target
)

Moves the last child before the target.  Returns true if the target is directly parented and the move operation is successful, false otherwise.

MoveLastChildAfterTargetChild
virtual bool MoveLastChildAfterTargetChild(
ssGUI::GUIObject* target
)

Moves the last child after the target.  Returns true if the target is directly parented and the move operation is successful, false otherwise.

MoveFirstChildBeforeTargetChild
virtual bool MoveFirstChildBeforeTargetChild(
ssGUI::GUIObject* target
)

Moves the first child before the target.  Returns true if the target is directly parented and the move operation is successful, false otherwise.

MoveFirstChildAfterTargetChild
virtual bool MoveFirstChildAfterTargetChild(
ssGUI::GUIObject* target
)

Moves the first child after the target.  Returns true if the target is directly parented and the move operation is successful, false otherwise.

MoveChildToFirst
virtual bool MoveChildToFirst(
ssGUI::GUIObject* child
)

Moves the child to the beginning of the children.  Returns true if the target is directly parented and the move operation is successful, false otherwise.

MoveChildToLast
virtual bool MoveChildToLast(
ssGUI::GUIObject* child
)

Moves the child to the end of the children.  Returns true if the target is directly parented and the move operation is successful, false otherwise.

ChangeChildOrderToBeforePosition (Obselete)
virtual void ChangeChildOrderToBeforePosition(
ssGUI::Hierarchy::ChildToken child,
ssGUI::Hierarchy::ChildToken position
)

Changes the child's position to be in front of said position. Use GetCurrentChildToken to get the iterator.  Use MoveChildBeforeTargetChild instead.

ChangeChildOrderToAfterPosition (Obselete)
virtual void ChangeChildOrderToAfterPosition(
ssGUI::Hierarchy::ChildToken child,
ssGUI::Hierarchy::ChildToken position
)

Changes the child's position to be in behind of said position. Use GetCurrentChildToken to get the iterator.  Use MoveChildAfterTargetChild instead.

GetListOfChildren
virtual std::vector<ssGUI::GUIObject*> GetListOfChildren() const

Gets a list of children

Internal_AddChild
virtual void Internal_AddChild(
ssGUI::GUIObject* obj,
bool compositeChild
)

(Internal ssGUI function) Adds the GUI Object to the children record. Use SetParent instead for adding or removing child.

Internal_RemoveChild
virtual void Internal_RemoveChild(
ssGUI::GUIObject* obj
)

(Internal ssGUI function) Removes the GUI Object to the children record. Use SetParent instead for adding or removing child.

SetUserCreated
virtual void SetUserCreated(
bool created
)

Sets the UserCreated flag. True if this GUI Object's lifetime is managed explcitly, otherwise managed by ssGUI object/extension.

IsUserCreated
virtual bool IsUserCreated() const

Returns the UserCreated flag. True if this GUI Object's lifetime is managed explcitly, otherwise managed by ssGUI object/extension.

IsFocused
virtual bool IsFocused() const

Return if this GUI Object is focused

SetFocus
virtual void SetFocus(
bool focus
)

Set this GUI Object to be focused

Internal_SetSelfFocus
virtual void Internal_SetSelfFocus(
bool focus
)

(Internal ssGUI function) Set the focus of the GUI object without affect any other GUI object

Delete
virtual void Delete()

Delete the current GUI Object. This will unset the parent of this GUI Object and all it's references.  This will also deletes all of the children GUI Objects. If this is allocated on the heap, it will be deallocated automiactically. Any referencing to this GUI Object after deleted is undefined.

Internal_IsDeleted
virtual bool Internal_IsDeleted() const

(Internal ssGUI function) This is used to determined if this GUI Object is "deleted" or not.

SetHeapAllocated
virtual void SetHeapAllocated(
bool heap
)

Sets the HeapAllocated flag of this GUI Object. If true, this object will be deleted from the heap automatically after the Delete function is called.

IsHeapAllocated
virtual bool IsHeapAllocated() const

Gets the HeapAllocated flag of this GUI Object. If true, this object will be deleted from the heap automatically after the Delete function is called.

Internal_PrintParentStack
virtual void Internal_PrintParentStack() const

(Internal ssGUI function) Prints the parent stack in the log for debugging

Internal_PrintChildrenStack
virtual void Internal_PrintChildrenStack() const

(Internal ssGUI function) Prints the children stack in the log for debugging

Internal_ChildrenManualDeletion
virtual void Internal_ChildrenManualDeletion(
std::vector<ssGUI::ssGUIObjectIndex> generatedObjs
)

(Internal ssGUI function) Allow a composite GUI object to be able to deallocate itself with its generated GUI objects when the destructor is being called

Internal_GetObjectsReferences
virtual ObjectsReferences* Internal_GetObjectsReferences()

(Internal ssGUI function) Returns the pointer of the ObjectReferences
